trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot issues with Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot issues with Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: Learn about troubleshooting issues with Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: Learn about troubleshooting issues with Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: You can use the information in the following sections to help you troubleshoot problems.
trans-unit.target: You can use the information in the following sections to help you troubleshoot problems.

trans-unit.source: If the issue you're having isn't in this article, you can try the <linkText>Operational Insights team blog</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If the issue you're having isn't in this article, you can try the <linkText>Operational Insights team blog</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Because Microsoft Azure Operational Insights relies on data that is moved to and from the cloud, connection issues can be crippling.
trans-unit.target: Because Microsoft Azure Operational Insights relies on data that is moved to and from the cloud, connection issues can be crippling.

trans-unit.source: Use the following information to understand and solve your connection issues.
trans-unit.target: Use the following information to understand and solve your connection issues.

trans-unit.source: Error message: The Internet connectivity was verified, but connection to Operational Insights service could not be established.
trans-unit.target: Error message: The Internet connectivity was verified, but connection to Operational Insights service could not be established.

trans-unit.source: Please try again later.
trans-unit.target: Please try again later.

trans-unit.source: Possible causes:
trans-unit.target: Possible causes:

trans-unit.source: The Operational Insights service is under maintenance.
trans-unit.target: The Operational Insights service is under maintenance.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the Operational Insights maintenance is done.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the Operational Insights maintenance is done.

trans-unit.source: Your network has blocked Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: Your network has blocked Operational Insights.

trans-unit.source: Contact your network administrator and request access to Operational Insights, or use another server as your gateway.
trans-unit.target: Contact your network administrator and request access to Operational Insights, or use another server as your gateway.

trans-unit.source: Error message: Internet connection could not be established.
trans-unit.target: Error message: Internet connection could not be established.

trans-unit.source: Please check your proxy settings.
trans-unit.target: Please check your proxy settings.

trans-unit.source: Possible causes:
trans-unit.target: Possible causes:

trans-unit.source: This server is not connected to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: This server is not connected to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Check the Internet connectivity status, and connect the server to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: Check the Internet connectivity status, and connect the server to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: The proxy setting is not correct.
trans-unit.target: The proxy setting is not correct.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Configure proxy and firewall settings</linkText><title></title> for information about how to set or change your proxy settings.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Configure proxy and firewall settings</linkText><title></title> for information about how to set or change your proxy settings.

trans-unit.source: The proxy server requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: The proxy server requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Configure proxy and firewall settings</linkText><title></title> to learn about how to configure Operations Manager to use a proxy server.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Configure proxy and firewall settings</linkText><title></title> to learn about how to configure Operations Manager to use a proxy server.

trans-unit.source: If you are running Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2, and despite deploying the Operations Manager agent, you do not see alerts for this server, you might have a discovery issue.
trans-unit.target: If you are running Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2, and despite deploying the Operations Manager agent, you do not see alerts for this server, you might have a discovery issue.

trans-unit.source: To confirm if this is the source of your trouble, check for the following two issues:
trans-unit.target: To confirm if this is the source of your trouble, check for the following two issues:

trans-unit.source: In the Operations Manager event log, you see Event ID 4001.
trans-unit.target: In the Operations Manager event log, you see Event ID 4001.

trans-unit.source: This event indicates that there is an invalid class.
trans-unit.target: This event indicates that there is an invalid class.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Configuration Manager, when you view SQL Server Services, you see the error message, “The remote procedure call failed.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Configuration Manager, when you view SQL Server Services, you see the error message, “The remote procedure call failed.

trans-unit.source: If both issues are true, you need to install SQL Server 2008 R2 Service Pack 2.
trans-unit.target: If both issues are true, you need to install SQL Server 2008 R2 Service Pack 2.

trans-unit.source: To download this service pack, see <linkText>SQL Server 2008 R2 Service Pack 2</linkText><title></title> in the Microsoft Download Center.
trans-unit.target: To download this service pack, see <linkText>SQL Server 2008 R2 Service Pack 2</linkText><title></title> in the Microsoft Download Center.

trans-unit.source: After you install the service pack, you should see Operational Insights data for the server within 24 hours.
trans-unit.target: After you install the service pack, you should see Operational Insights data for the server within 24 hours.

trans-unit.source: The following set of procedures is meant as a guide to help you troubleshoot your directly-connected agents or Operations Manager deployments configured to report data to Azure Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: The following set of procedures is meant as a guide to help you troubleshoot your directly-connected agents or Operations Manager deployments configured to report data to Azure Operational Insights.

trans-unit.source: If you only use Direct Agent, you can skip to the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: If you only use Direct Agent, you can skip to the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: Depending on which solutions (previously called intelligence packs) you have enabled from the OpInsights Portal will you see more or less of these MPs.
trans-unit.target: Depending on which solutions (previously called intelligence packs) you have enabled from the OpInsights Portal will you see more or less of these MPs.

trans-unit.source: Search for keyword ‘Advisor’ or ‘Intelligence’ in their name.
trans-unit.target: Search for keyword ‘Advisor’ or ‘Intelligence’ in their name.

trans-unit.source: You can check for these MPs using OpsMgr PowerShell:
trans-unit.target: You can check for these MPs using OpsMgr PowerShell:

trans-unit.source: If you are troubleshooting the Capacity solution, check how many management packs with the name containing ‘capacity’ you have: there are two management packs that have the same display name (but different internal ID’s) that come in the same MP bundle; if one of the two does not get imported (often due to missing VMM dependency) the other MP does not get imported and the operation does not retry.
trans-unit.target: If you are troubleshooting the Capacity solution, check how many management packs with the name containing ‘capacity’ you have: there are two management packs that have the same display name (but different internal ID’s) that come in the same MP bundle; if one of the two does not get imported (often due to missing VMM dependency) the other MP does not get imported and the operation does not retry.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following three management packs related to ‘capacity’
trans-unit.target: You should see the following three management packs related to ‘capacity’

trans-unit.source: Microsoft System Center Advisor Capacity Intelligence Pack
trans-unit.target: Microsoft System Center Advisor Capacity Intelligence Pack

trans-unit.source: Microsoft System Center Advisor Capacity Intelligence Pack
trans-unit.target: Microsoft System Center Advisor Capacity Intelligence Pack

trans-unit.source: Microsoft System Center Advisor Capacity Storage Data
trans-unit.target: Microsoft System Center Advisor Capacity Storage Data

trans-unit.source: If you only see one or two of them but not all three, remove it and wait 5/10 minutes for Operations Manager to download and import it again – check the event logs for errors during this period.
trans-unit.target: If you only see one or two of them but not all three, remove it and wait 5/10 minutes for Operations Manager to download and import it again – check the event logs for errors during this period.

trans-unit.source: If you only use Operations Manager, you can ignore this procedure.
trans-unit.target: If you only use Operations Manager, you can ignore this procedure.

trans-unit.source: In Direct Agent you should see the solution collection policy being cached under C:\Program Files\Microsoft Monitoring Agent\Agent\Health Service State\Management Packs
trans-unit.target: In Direct Agent you should see the solution collection policy being cached under C:\Program Files\Microsoft Monitoring Agent\Agent\Health Service State\Management Packs

trans-unit.source: Depending if you are using Directly-connected agents or Operations Manager, you can perform the following procedure on the direct agent machine or on the Operations Manager management server:
trans-unit.target: Depending if you are using Directly-connected agents or Operations Manager, you can perform the following procedure on the direct agent machine or on the Operations Manager management server:

trans-unit.source: Open ‘Performance Monitor’
trans-unit.target: Open ‘Performance Monitor’

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Health Service Management Groups’
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Health Service Management Groups’

trans-unit.source: Add all the counters that start with ‘HTTP’
trans-unit.target: Add all the counters that start with ‘HTTP’

trans-unit.source: If things are configured right you should see activity for these counters, as events and other data items (based on the solutions onboarded in the portal, and the configured log collection policy) are uploaded.
trans-unit.target: If things are configured right you should see activity for these counters, as events and other data items (based on the solutions onboarded in the portal, and the configured log collection policy) are uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Those counters don’t necessarily have to be continuously ‘busy’ - if you see little to no activity it might be that you are not onboarded on many solutions or have a very lightweight collection policy.
trans-unit.target: Those counters don’t necessarily have to be continuously ‘busy’ - if you see little to no activity it might be that you are not onboarded on many solutions or have a very lightweight collection policy.

trans-unit.source: As a final step if all of the above fails but you still see no data received by the service, check if you are seeing any errors in Event Viewer.
trans-unit.target: As a final step if all of the above fails but you still see no data received by the service, check if you are seeing any errors in Event Viewer.

trans-unit.source: Open Event Viewer –> Application and Services –> Operations Manager and filter by Event Sources: Advisor, Health Service Modules, HealthService and Service Connector (this last one applies to Direct Agent only).
trans-unit.target: Open Event Viewer –> Application and Services –> Operations Manager and filter by Event Sources: Advisor, Health Service Modules, HealthService and Service Connector (this last one applies to Direct Agent only).

trans-unit.source: Most of these events would be similar in either Operations Manager and on Direct Agent and the steps for troubleshooting would be similar for either.
trans-unit.target: Most of these events would be similar in either Operations Manager and on Direct Agent and the steps for troubleshooting would be similar for either.

trans-unit.source: The only part that differs between Operations Manager and Direct Agent is the registration process (GUI in Operations Manager; workspace Id/Key combination in Direct agent) but, after initial registration, certificates are exchanges and used and everything else about the communication with the service is the same.
trans-unit.target: The only part that differs between Operations Manager and Direct Agent is the registration process (GUI in Operations Manager; workspace Id/Key combination in Direct agent) but, after initial registration, certificates are exchanges and used and everything else about the communication with the service is the same.

trans-unit.source: Hence, many of these events apply to both types of reporting infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Hence, many of these events apply to both types of reporting infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: Here's a list of the common ones you might see.
trans-unit.target: Here's a list of the common ones you might see.

trans-unit.source: This means your proxy requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This means your proxy requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Please follow the steps to <linkText>configure proxy servers</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Please follow the steps to <linkText>configure proxy servers</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Operations Manager cannot read the authentication certificate.
trans-unit.target: Operations Manager cannot read the authentication certificate.

trans-unit.source: Re-running the Advisor registration wizard will fix certificates/runas accounts
trans-unit.target: Re-running the Advisor registration wizard will fix certificates/runas accounts

trans-unit.source: Means Not Authorized.
trans-unit.target: Means Not Authorized.

trans-unit.source: Could be an issue with the certificate and/or registration to the service; try re-running the registration wizard that will fix certificates and RunAs accounts.
trans-unit.target: Could be an issue with the certificate and/or registration to the service; try re-running the registration wizard that will fix certificates and RunAs accounts.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, verify the proxy has been set to allow exclusions.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, verify the proxy has been set to allow exclusions.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <linkText>configure proxy servers</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information see <linkText>configure proxy servers</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: This is a failed connection due to failed SSL negotiation.
trans-unit.target: This is a failed connection due to failed SSL negotiation.

trans-unit.source: Verify that your systems are configured to use TLS and not SSL.
trans-unit.target: Verify that your systems are configured to use TLS and not SSL.

trans-unit.source: There could be some strange SSL settings on this server with regards to chipers, either in the Internet Explorer Advanced options, or in the Windows registry under the key
trans-unit.target: There could be some strange SSL settings on this server with regards to chipers, either in the Internet Explorer Advanced options, or in the Windows registry under the key

trans-unit.source: Failure sending data received error code.
trans-unit.target: Failure sending data received error code.

trans-unit.source: If this only happens once in a while, it could be just a glitch.
trans-unit.target: If this only happens once in a while, it could be just a glitch.

trans-unit.source: Keep an eye on it, to understand how often it happens.
trans-unit.target: Keep an eye on it, to understand how often it happens.

trans-unit.source: If the same appears very often (every 10 minutes or so for an extended period of time), then it could be a real issue – check your network configuration, proxy settings described above, and re-run registration wizard.
trans-unit.target: If the same appears very often (every 10 minutes or so for an extended period of time), then it could be a real issue – check your network configuration, proxy settings described above, and re-run registration wizard.

trans-unit.source: But if it only happens sporadically (i.e. a couple of times per day) then everything should be fine, as data will be queued and retransmitted.
trans-unit.target: But if it only happens sporadically (i.e. a couple of times per day) then everything should be fine, as data will be queued and retransmitted.

trans-unit.source: It's probably just a network timeout if that's the frequency at which it occurs.
trans-unit.target: It's probably just a network timeout if that's the frequency at which it occurs.

trans-unit.source: Some of the HTTP error codes have some special meanings, i.e.:
trans-unit.target: Some of the HTTP error codes have some special meanings, i.e.:

trans-unit.source: the FIRST time that a MMA direct agent or management server tries to send data to our service, it will get a 500 error with an inner 404 error code – 404 means not found; this indicates that the storage area we’ll use for this new workspace of yours isn’t quite ready yet – it is being provisioned.
trans-unit.target: the FIRST time that a MMA direct agent or management server tries to send data to our service, it will get a 500 error with an inner 404 error code – 404 means not found; this indicates that the storage area we’ll use for this new workspace of yours isn’t quite ready yet – it is being provisioned.

trans-unit.source: On next retry, this will however be ready and flow will start working (under normal conditions).
trans-unit.target: On next retry, this will however be ready and flow will start working (under normal conditions).

trans-unit.source: 403 might indicate a permission/credential issue, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: 403 might indicate a permission/credential issue, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: DNS name resolution failed.
trans-unit.target: DNS name resolution failed.

trans-unit.source: You server can’t resolve our internet address it is supposed to send data to.
trans-unit.target: You server can’t resolve our internet address it is supposed to send data to.

trans-unit.source: This might be DNS resolver settings on your machine, incorrect proxy settings, or a (temporary) issue with DNS at your provider.
trans-unit.target: This might be DNS resolver settings on your machine, incorrect proxy settings, or a (temporary) issue with DNS at your provider.

trans-unit.source: Like the previous event, depending if it happens constantly or ‘once in a while’ it could indicate a real issue – or not.
trans-unit.target: Like the previous event, depending if it happens constantly or ‘once in a while’ it could indicate a real issue – or not.

trans-unit.source: Timeout.
trans-unit.target: Timeout.

trans-unit.source: Like the previous event, depending if it happens constantly or ‘once in a while’ it could be an issue – or not.
trans-unit.target: Like the previous event, depending if it happens constantly or ‘once in a while’ it could be an issue – or not.

trans-unit.source: Cannot load module "System.PublishDataToEndPoint" – file not found.
trans-unit.target: Cannot load module "System.PublishDataToEndPoint" – file not found.

trans-unit.source: Initialization of a module of type "System.PublishDataToEndPoint" (CLSID "{D407D659-65E4-4476-BF40-924E56841465}") failed with error code The system cannot find the file specified.
trans-unit.target: Initialization of a module of type "System.PublishDataToEndPoint" (CLSID "{D407D659-65E4-4476-BF40-924E56841465}") failed with error code The system cannot find the file specified.

trans-unit.source: This error indicates you have old DLLs on your machine, that don’t contain the required modules.
trans-unit.target: This error indicates you have old DLLs on your machine, that don’t contain the required modules.

trans-unit.source: The fix is to update your Management Servers to the latest Update Rollup.
trans-unit.target: The fix is to update your Management Servers to the latest Update Rollup.

trans-unit.source: Module crashed.
trans-unit.target: Module crashed.

trans-unit.source: If you see this for workflows with names such as CollectInstanceSpace or CollectTypeSpace it might mean the server is having issues to send some configuration data.
trans-unit.target: If you see this for workflows with names such as CollectInstanceSpace or CollectTypeSpace it might mean the server is having issues to send some configuration data.

trans-unit.source: Depending on how often it happens - constantly or ‘once in a while’ - it could be an issue or not.
trans-unit.target: Depending on how often it happens - constantly or ‘once in a while’ - it could be an issue or not.

trans-unit.source: If it happens more that every hour it is definitely an issue.
trans-unit.target: If it happens more that every hour it is definitely an issue.

trans-unit.source: If only fails this operation once or twice per day, it will be fine an able to recover.
trans-unit.target: If only fails this operation once or twice per day, it will be fine an able to recover.

trans-unit.source: Depending on how the module actually fails (description will have more details) this could be an on-premises issue – i.e. to collect to DB – or an issue sending to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Depending on how the module actually fails (description will have more details) this could be an on-premises issue – i.e. to collect to DB – or an issue sending to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Verify your network and proxy settings, and worst case try restarting the HealthService.
trans-unit.target: Verify your network and proxy settings, and worst case try restarting the HealthService.

trans-unit.source: Module "System.PublishDataToEndPoint" crashed.
trans-unit.target: Module "System.PublishDataToEndPoint" crashed.

trans-unit.source: A module of type "System.PublishDataToEndPoint" reported an error 87L which was running as part of rule "Microsoft.SystemCenter.CollectAlertChangeDataToCloud" running for instance "Operations Manager Management Group" with id:"{6B1D1BE8-EBB4-B425-08DC-2385C5930B04}" in management group "SCOMTEST".
trans-unit.target: A module of type "System.PublishDataToEndPoint" reported an error 87L which was running as part of rule "Microsoft.SystemCenter.CollectAlertChangeDataToCloud" running for instance "Operations Manager Management Group" with id:"{6B1D1BE8-EBB4-B425-08DC-2385C5930B04}" in management group "SCOMTEST".

trans-unit.source: You should not see this with this exact workflow, module and error anymore, it used to be [a bug now fixed](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/267889-azure-operational-insights/suggestions/6714689-alert-management-intelligence-pack-not-sending-ale).
trans-unit.target: You should not see this with this exact workflow, module and error anymore, it used to be [a bug now fixed](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/267889-azure-operational-insights/suggestions/6714689-alert-management-intelligence-pack-not-sending-ale).

trans-unit.source: If you see this again please report it thru your preferred Microsoft support channel.
trans-unit.target: If you see this again please report it thru your preferred Microsoft support channel.

trans-unit.source: The service returned HTTP status code 403 in response to a query. Please check with the service administrator for the health of the service. The query will be retried later. You can get a 403 during the agent’s initial registration phase, you’ll see a URL like https://<YourWorkspaceID>.oms.opinsights.azure.com/ AgentService.svc/AgentTopologyRequest Error code 403 means ‘fordbidden’ – this is typically a wrongly-copied WorkspaceId or key, or the clock is not synced on the machine. Try synchronising with a reliable time source and use the connectivity check in the Control Panel applet for Microsoft Monitoring Agent to verify you have the right workspace Id and Key.
trans-unit.target: The service returned HTTP status code 403 in response to a query. Please check with the service administrator for the health of the service. The query will be retried later. You can get a 403 during the agent’s initial registration phase, you’ll see a URL like https://<YourWorkspaceID>.oms.opinsights.azure.com/ AgentService.svc/AgentTopologyRequest Error code 403 means ‘fordbidden’ – this is typically a wrongly-copied WorkspaceId or key, or the clock is not synced on the machine. Try synchronising with a reliable time source and use the connectivity check in the Control Panel applet for Microsoft Monitoring Agent to verify you have the right workspace Id and Key.

trans-unit.source: Check in the OpInsights Portal, from Overview page navigate to the small tile Servers and Usage – this will show if management groups (and their agents) and direct agents are reporting data into log search.
trans-unit.target: Check in the OpInsights Portal, from Overview page navigate to the small tile Servers and Usage – this will show if management groups (and their agents) and direct agents are reporting data into log search.

trans-unit.source: The number of agents on the tile is derived from data – if machines don’t report for 2 weeks they’ll drop off the radar.
trans-unit.target: The number of agents on the tile is derived from data – if machines don’t report for 2 weeks they’ll drop off the radar.

trans-unit.source: The drill downs take you to log search and show the last indexed data’s timestamp for each machine.
trans-unit.target: The drill downs take you to log search and show the last indexed data’s timestamp for each machine.

trans-unit.source: From there you can explore what data it is.
trans-unit.target: From there you can explore what data it is.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the amount of data collection configured and which solutions, data upload schedule and speed can vary.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the amount of data collection configured and which solutions, data upload schedule and speed can vary.

trans-unit.source: This page also features metering information (this does not use the log search index but the billing system, it’s refreshed every couple of hours) about the amounts of data sent to the service broken down by solution.
trans-unit.target: This page also features metering information (this does not use the log search index but the billing system, it’s refreshed every couple of hours) about the amounts of data sent to the service broken down by solution.
